Docs.summary: Represents a row within a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> class is used to represent an individual row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. Each row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control has a designated row type. The following table lists the row types that are valid for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.DataRow>|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.EmptyDataRow>|The empty data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The empty data row is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control when there are no records to display.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Footer>|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Header>|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Pager>|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.|
To determine the row type of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowType%2A> property. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object also has a state associated with it. The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.
|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState.Alternate>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState.Edit>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState.Insert>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in insert mode.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState.Normal>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.|
To determine the state of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowState%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control stores all its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> collection. To determine the index of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowIndex%2A> property.
You can access the individual cells of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property. If a cell contains controls, you can retrieve a control from the cell by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the cell. You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the cell to find the control, if the control has an <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property specified.
To retrieve a field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> field column or an automatically generated field column, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property of the cell. To retrieve a field value from other field column types where the field value is bound to a control, first retrieve the control from the appropriate cell and then access the appropriate property of the control.
> [!NOTE] > It is possible to use a data-binding expression directly in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField> field column without binding the value to a property of a control. In this case, the field value is automatically placed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control. To retrieve the field value, you must first retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control from the appropriate cell and then use its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.

## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowState%2A> property to determine the state of the row. The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.
|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Alternate`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Insert`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in insert mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.|
This property is commonly used to determine the state of a row before performing an operation.

|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowType.DataRow`|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.EmptyDataRow`|The empty data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The empty data row is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control when there are no records to display.| |`DataControlRowType.Footer`|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Header`|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Pager`|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.|
This property is commonly used to determine a row's type before performing an operation.
